programme.title: Bahrain F1 GP Highlights

programme.title: Saudi Arabian F1 GP Highlights

programme.title: Miami F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: Polesitter Max Verstappen is joined by Lando Norris and Kimi Antonelli heading into turn one, while Lewis Hamilton tries to fight through the field from P12. (04.05)

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian

programme.title: The Warrior

programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: (1955) A non-stop romp of a western from director Joseph H Lewis. In the town of Medicine Bend, only Marshal Calem Ware can keep its citizens from falling into complete lawlessness.

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: (1952) War drama. Trevor Howard plays the captain of an ageing US warship, gifted to the British navy, which is chosen to lead the raid on Saint-Nazaire in 1942. With Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: (1965) A spin-off of the cult television series starring Peter Cushing. Backyard-inventor Dr Who finds himself stuck on the irradiated planet Skaro, home of the cold and metallic Daleks.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: No Exit
programme.desc: (2022) Thriller. A recovering addict ends up stranded at a remote visitor centre in a snowstorm with four strangers, then finds a kidnapped girl in the car park. Question is: who did it?

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: (2018) Crime drama. Jakob Cedergren stars as a troubled cop, confined to the office, who must race against time to help a distressed woman. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Young Winston

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 11, as the riders returned to the saddle after a rest day to face a flat 156.8km route starting and finishing in Toulouse. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett and Peter Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James cooks a dish of lamb from the salt marshes of Wales, learns how to cook Richard Bertinet's puffballs and gives a masterclass in the right way to make custard. He also serves classic French cuisine for his guest Lisa Snowdon and chefs Claude Bosi and Jonny Lake

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Alexander Armstrong, Natasha Hamilton and Jamie Laing to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Luton husband and wife Mark and Jheanell, Pete and his daughter Sam from Coventry, and friends Banita and Seema from London use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as contestants Cindy, Peter, Mat and Alice pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Everyone gathers as Nate's funeral takes place, while John struggles under pressure and Paddy tries to stifle his panic

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: A Conversation with Lorna Dawson
programme.desc: Lorna Dawson, a forensic scientist who helped crack some of Scotland's most high-profile cases, discusses how soil science is solving crime and why the ground beneath our feet holds more clues than we think

programme.title: 800 Words: STV Player Presents
programme.desc: George Turner's plan to kick-start his family back into life by shifting them all across the Tasman to the town of Weld, New Zealand, does not get off to an ideal start.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the stories of foundlings as they search for answers about why they were left as babies and try to find their birth families. A man left as a baby in a London phone box more than 50 years ago discovers an extraordinary family history on the other side of the world.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 12, a 180.6km route from Auch to Hautacam. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Danube
programme.desc: The second leg of Joanna's adventure takes her to the landlocked countries of Slovakia and Hungary. She traces Danube tributaries to the top of the dramatic Tatras mountains in Slovakia, explores the river by boat in Budapest, rides a children's railway, and discovers the city's Jewish heritage. The actress and presenter also meets Hungary's cowboys

programme.title: Unwind with STV

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the 13th stage, a 10.9km individual time-trial from Loudenvielle to Peyragudes. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes perfect for al fresco dining, including Cypriot lamb chops, cherry tomato skewers and potato salad. Supper Club host Joseph Denison Carey serves up a tagliatelle, and Ainsley shows guest Dev Griffin how to make sesame and singer seabass with an Asian noodles salad. Olly Smith has canned drinks perfect for the great outdoors

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar's guest is singer Chesney Hawkes, with Shivi serving up smashed breakfast tacos and drinks expert Andy Clarke joins the gang for a tequila tasting. Jimmy checks in on the snakes at the wildlife park to make sure that they're growing properly, and Max McMurdo makes a handy bread-slicing device

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at his Hampshire home this time by singer-songwriter Jack Savoretti, Midsomer Murders star Neil Dudgeon, and chefs Glynn Purnell and Sabrina Gidda.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make four mouth-watering dishes with only five main ingredients, starting with a garlic and rosemary focaccia, followed by John's pink spaghetti. Following that are chicken and peanut butter scissor-cut noodles and moreish and fuss-free banana doughnuts.

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef returns to Highgrove House in Gloucestershire, the family residence of King Charles and Queen Camilla. Mel takes him around some of their vegetable beds while chatting about how she came to be a gardener for the King, while royal beekeeper Stephen demonstrates the art of managing hives as he and Raymond discuss their shared passion for bees and honey

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Toby Anstis, Paula Radcliffe, Rav Wilding and Vanessa Feltz pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the fourth and concluding quarter-final, held at St. Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. France finished top of Group D after winning all three of their group matches, including a 2-1 victory over holders England. Their opponents finished second in Group C after defeating Poland and Denmark, but suffering a 4-1 defeat at the hands of table-toppers Sweden last time out

Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.
